review: Typically, I am not a chain kinda gal, ya know? I hold fast to that, every time someone suggest California Pizza kitchen, I am reluctant to go. Every time! And every time I am proven wrong and pleasantly surprised by the spot.   The menu is great! They truly have something for everyone! I love the numerous sections for healthy eaters or vegetarians.    What I love about this spot is obviously, the menu and here are a few other things.. they have a valet right out front. They have tons of seating so you will never wait for a table. Service is always great. They have outdoor seating for nice days. They also have a little outdoor area if your kiddos need to walk a bit.    What I don't love is the cocktails, they are always so sweet. I also do not love the size of the pizzas, a large is quite small. Other than that, this is a great family spot.    We homeschool, I always have my kiddos with me. When out running errands I know this will be a convenient crowd pleasing spot, even if I am reluctant to drop my no chains attitude. When the moon hits your eye like a big pizza pie... enjoy!

I appreciate the GM reached out to rectify my previous poor experience! We met him on my first review and he was really friendly and welcoming!  Hope they spend more time training their staff... Probably will not be back to this location ---great opportunity to try other eateries on this strip. Plus, menu is very limited for this location unlike other CPK.

Good restaurant, good food, good service. The only thing that keeps this review from four stars is that I think it's a little pricey for what you get. We always get the bbq chicken pizza which is really good and if you've never had it, you need to get it. Chicken, red onions, bbq sauce and mozzarella cheese. We also get the chicken Milanese which is breaded and pan fried chicken topped with arugula, diced tomatoes, Parmesan cheese and they give you a lemon wrapped in cheesecloth to squeeze over the top. I think they give complementary bread to the tables, but we weren't offered any. And we probably didn't need any with all the pizza.

I love California pizza kitchen, being someone who hates gooey cheesy pizza ( I know! Shoot me now) it's hard for me to find a place that caters to my love of crust and toppings but also recognizes my disdain for melted cheese. I ordered the California club pizza which comes with arugula, bacon, chicken, avocado, romaine lettuce and a cilantro cream sauce for the topping. This pizza was perfect! Crisp crust, juicy chicken, not too much cheese but the perfect combination of spice and cool flavors. My girlfriend ordered the pepperoni and sausage pizza which comes with handmade spicy sausage. The flavors of that meat made me think of Sicily. Our server was awesome. She took time to suggest drinks we should try, and just had a great demeanor our entire visit. This place is in a great location ok "Restaurant Row" in Hughes Landing.  Tip: after you leave, head to your right and pick up some macaroons for dessert from Macaroons by Patisse.

California pizza kitchen is by far the best restaurant that I have probably been to that actually genuinely takes care of their customers. There were a couple of huge parties at their restaurants and we had to wait for about two hours for our food and the owner was extremely friendly and kind and she apologized and paid for our food. I have never had this experience before and I can positively say that the waiting was a bit annoying but they were extremely accommodating.  As for the food, it was awesome. I have never had pizza like this ever. It was fresh and start out of the oven. They have a great variety of dishes on their menu and it comes in reasonably priced large portions. Great for brunch or dinner with kids.

Man they must be killing it. I stopped by at 10:30 to order a few pizzas and a group of workers were sitting at a table as I walked in. I said are you opened. They all looked at each other and said no we aren't. To say the very least I will not be back. That's embarrassing.  Where is manAgement?

I feel guilty liking a chain. The lunch deals are great though and you can get in and out quicker than other spots in the area.  The lunch menu can get pretty caloric as a "lunch pizza" alone is 600+ calories without the side salad or sandwich. I recently discovered the "half salad" option from the regular menu which also serves as a nice lunch option- solid portion less than 12 dollars.   There's a nice patio out back overlooking Hughes waterway and on a nice day it's perfect for a drink or outdoor lunch.

CPK was our go-to back home so when they finally opened a restaurant in Hughes Landing we were excited to go and eat our favorite dishes. The Thai pizza is hands down a unique blend of flavors. Its so delicious and I hope they never take this off the menu.  Our pepperoni pizza was burnt so the chef was kind enough to come out and apologize and fix us a new one for free!   Service was friendly and food was yummy. We'll be back.

15 ladies doing lunch!! We had a reservation for 12 but at last minute (like minutes before we arrived) called to see if we could add more, no problem! We arrived and tables set up and ready for us. Wait staff were super efficient, they even did separate checks for us all!! It was my first visit here and was impressed by menu, expected just pizza maybe a few other items. WRONG, menu is quite varied. I had the buffalo cauliflower, my new fave food, just need the recipe (hint, hint!) it was so good! Everyone seemed to enjoy their dish and looking around the tables was impressed by diversity, all looking great! I'll definitely return here.

This was a good place to eat some lunch. My fiancé had a carne asada pizza, and my sister as usual a spinach pizza because she's a vegetarian.  Whenever she got her pizza it had pieces of meat but no big deal. It was a great place to eat at.

Get the butter cake. It's life changing. I come here for a nice date night with the man about once a month. I am never disappointed by the food. I get the south west pizza and the sauce it comes with to die for.

Great restaurant with really good service. We have the avocado egg rolls plus the baked potatoes soup is amazing. The location is nice and clean, the friendly atmosphere brings the whole experience together. This is a great location for lunch or a quick dinner. Oh they are also kid friendly.
When there last week. The people were very sweet always checking on us. The food was great and make sure our food was on point. Loveee it mainly the spot where its locate it.

This would be a five star review except for one thing.  The size of the pizza is ridiculously small.  I thought everything was bigger in Texas!!  It is basically a personal size pizza so if you are used to ordering for a family just double what you would normally get and you will be fine....and broke. We ordered a half size grilled vegetable salad and a mushroom pizza and it was $30.00.   As I said, if I doubled the order it would have been the right amount of food.  As for the actual food - pretty good.  Crust was crispy on outside and chewy on the inside ( which is the way it's supposed to be Texas!!) and the mushrooms were good and tasteful Even though the food is good I don't think I will be going back as I don't like to have to go out to eat after I go out to eat.

Can't comment on food because I couldn't order. Despite the hours posted on the cpk website and the Yelp page, when we called to order this location says they closed at 9 pm. Way to lose business, guys.
I'm seating in the patio of the California Pizza in the Woodlands,with my husband... enjoying a delicious Blueberry Ginger Smash and Artichokes and Spinach Dip.

Im going to start this review off with saying the food on 5/11/17  was 2 star Quality but the service displayed by our server Dre made up for it. From the time we sat down to the time we left he had us laughing. Dre is a very funny young man and even when we complained about our food being burnt he apologized and cracked a joke about how it was his fault because he was too hot. Dre is the only reason me and my sister will even think about coming back.  If you happen to come to CPK ask for Dre.

When we first got there a very unfriedly, long faced hostess told us it would take 15 mins to be sitted. After the 15 mins she called us for a table in a very rude way, almost mad, to the point I wanted to ask if she was ok. We got to our table and had a really nice young lady as our server.  Our dinner was ok. We have visited other locations and had some of the same items. We were informed that pizza was gonna take a little longer than usual, I was ok with that and the server made sure we had bread and drinks. Also the other items my family ordered were already there at our table. Eventually my pizza came, but to my dissapoitment it was cold, so I didn't enjoyed it much. Server offered to warm it up  when I mentioned to her, but it was kinda late and I didn't wanna wait when my family had alread finished eating. I also ordered a grilled vegetables salad that I didn't enjoy much either as it had a lot of dressing. I shared with my husband and he thought the same. The dressing didn't allow us to enjoy the salad. It had too much dressing, it was overwhelming. Over all the visit was ok. Three things to sum it all up: 1.Terrible hostess, no smile, just plain annoyed face and rude.  2.Great server 3.meh food.

Pathetic service. Waitstaff are mostly confused and incompetent. The place is not even half full and haven't seen a waiter in the last 20 minutes.  The food is decent, so 2 stars instead of 1. Given then rent they must pay at this location and the lack of patrons, I doubt this place will last.  Avoid

I was so excited to try CPK's new seasonal menu and walked away totally pleased.  There seasonal menu consists of everything but pizza and I was ok with that.  The California Fields Salad, Fire-grilled Ribeye, Hearth Roasted Halibut and the Chicken Picatta were all delicious, but the best part was their new cocktail program. The new cocktails: Executive Decision, California Roots and the Blueberry Ginger Smash are all worth a try. I highly recommend the "California Roots" as it is made with fresh avocado!

Came for a late lunch, so first I have to say, it was not crowded. Our waiter was attentive and refilled our drinks regularly. Our food came out in an appropriate time. It was delicious!  I had the shrimp scampi zucchini. Fresh vegetables, perfectly cooked pasta. The most pleasurable meal I've had out in a long time! My husband enjoyed his meal too! He doesn't say that often. Can't wait to come back again!

We liked CPK when we were in California, and the one in Galleria area was good too. So I can't wait to try this new CPK in the woodlands area.  The restaurant is right at the bank of Lake Woodlands, and the lake view is nice. However the food was kind of disappointing. I ordered the original BBQ pizza, with pineapple. The taste was OK, but the pizza was burnt (the back of the pizza was almost all black). The pineapple was cut in pretty big size, which was a little weird to me.  So 2 stars for the food, and 1 star for the lake view.

Well, we we're pumped they built a CPK in the area, unfortunately, our visit was not up to par.  Our waiter was great, but he was triple sat, which meant no drinks, napkins, etc the entire visit.  The BBQ CHOP salad was good as expected.  The pizza was a bust. We got a thin crust pizza that was chewy... Have had better pizza out of the freezer... Manager walked around restaurant aimlessly, never once checked on our table.  Overall experience was poor, we won't be back.

15 minutes: no acknowledgement, no drinks, finally got up and left and the manager told us to have goodnight after he had literally just welcomed us in. Clearly not paying attention to customers. All of the waitstaff was screwing around by the bar. Will definitely not go back. There is plenty of fabulous pizza around The Woodlands, we don't need this place.

The horrible service at CPK made me to write this review, and it's my first ever review on yelp. I went twice there,  and both the times I was disappointed.  They need new management to manage waiters, otherwise this place will be a back star for CPK chain.
Meh.... What else is there to say. Service is ok, food is meh, typical chain restaurant. Lacking tons and should probably stay in California. When is Texas Pizza Kitchen opening ?

Horrible service.  This place is a joke! We went there for the gluten-free menu.  It took 10 minutes to get drinks.  Then the drinks were wrong.  I asked to speak to the manager and it took forever.  I finally found him walking on the street in front of the restaurant.  He then came to the table and brought us bread sticks!!!  Remember, we are gluten-free!!!  We cannot eat bread sticks!!!  We then started yelling at him about the horrible service.  He asked us to stop being rude and yelling at him.  We then left and went to the restaurant next door called Escalate's.  The service there was excellent!!!
Rude staff. They act like they are doing you a favor, like they are a five star restaurant with a dress code when their food is mediocre at best. Uncomfortable to go here for a pizza.

We went here for diner and I was craving some pizza. They told us it was a 20 min wait which was okay since it was Friday. 30 minutes later we ask how much longer and they say it's almost ready. It took 45 minutes to get a table and we ended up getting seated at a table that was open since the time we got there (I could see plenty of tables open from the moment we walked in). While we were waiting, it seemed that everyone coming in after was getting seated before us. There reasoning was they called ahead. I believe some people did but it seemed like it was highly unlikely everyone did call ahead. The food was okay but my mojito was really good. Overall I wouldn't come again.

I am writing this review from a restaurant next door to California Pizza Kitchen. We came to the restaurant as a family of 5 and were treated so rudely by the "hostesses", before we were even seated, that we left. It is expensive to take a big family out to eat, so being treated with disrespect is not acceptable. The restaurant was practically empty, there were at least 4 tables to accommodate us, and the hostesses would not seat us, instead saying it would be a 10 minute wait. When I asked why, when there were available tables right in front of us that would be fine, I was given a blank stare and just repeatedly told that it would be 10 minutes. When we decided to leave, the "hostesses" mocked us as we left. I highly recommend Escalantes, who seated us immediately despite being twice as crowded as CPK, were very friendly, and the food was great. There are too many restaurants in The Woodlands to choose from to be treated poorly.

Been going to CPK all my life and ordering the same Italian chopped salad. My only bad comment was it was not chopped up small like normally. But the service was amazing, sat out side on a beautiful patio overlooking the water. We even mentioned it was our first time at this location and the manager brought out their delicious quesadilla and introduced himself. Amazing! I work in the food industry and for this type of service you would normally pay much more. Can't wait to go back!

First day at new office in Hughes Landing. A group of nine went for lunch. Took almost two hours start to finish from about 1120 til after 1.  Service was confused but at least the food was good.   The gift cards were not such a deal as I was charged then told it did not work. So paid cash then checked balance and it was deducted.  The manager did fix this but the 15% "bonus" is only good for January/February not much good for me as I'll be out of town.   My fault for not asking to see the details first Would not give a recommendation for lunch here until they settle things down there!

Horrible service, our waitress was terrible, the restaurant wasn't even busy, now our kids food and appetizer was great, but than she never came back to take our order, because every parent knows place your little ones order first because as parents we have a small window to eat, we had to ask someone to find our waitress, finally ordered and our food came o ordered the sunny side up pizza,it was great, my husband unfortunately was not so good and I told him to order it because last time I had it was yummy, it was really burnt and by than he was just over it! Our waitress called the manager over who was very nice, overall it was good but this waitress we had maybe needs to find employment elsewhere and not waitressing.

Great location next to the water, ant terrific food. Our waiter, Isiah, was an earnest young man willing to learn the ropes of his craft, and attentively observed how to open a bottle of wine and place it in a chiller. He was also quick to have management replace a glass of wine the wind spilt. Hope we see him the next time we visit.

They have a very extensive menu, with a combination of thai or asian food and pizza. The california club pizza its very good, its a salad on top of a pizza with a very nice crust bread. We tried a combination of appetizers that were just ok, avocado egg rolls, lettuce wraps, spinach dip. The mahi tacos, could be much better, they had very hard pieces of fried breading, and didn't like the flour tortilla for it. Kids had pastas, they were very simple and not worth the value, plus they did not include the drinks. Service was slow, our waitress tried her best, but the kitchen was really slow. This place could be much better with a good manager.

The wait staff was great and the food was good. The pepperoni pizza with truffle oil was our favorite! The truffle oil brought out so much flavor in the pizza. Definitely recommend paying the extra price to have the truffle oil.

Walked from our embassy suite to this restaurant and enjoyed a nice dinner. Good service and food. We ordered the guacamole and chicken fettuccine Alfredo. Very delicious! Guacamole is small but has amazing flavor! Chicken fettuccine Alfredo was large enough to share for 2. Would def return again.

I normally don't rate chains, but the lady handling the to go orders was so great and good service deserves to be recognized. She greeted me by name when I walked up, made sure the order was correct and looked good, and sent me on my way. No waiting and the food was still hot when I got it home. Seems simple, but getting hot and accurate to go food is a rarity these days. Really wish I had thought to ask her name.
Lunch at CPK.... Had the Gorgonzola & Pear pizza, it has become my favorite. Great service, great food, I'm hooked..

First time at this location.  Was somewhat disappointed as I have had good experiences at other locations.  We sat outside next to the lake, which was nice. Staff was pleasant but food took a very long time to serve and was mediocre at best.   Mahi mahi tacos featured way overcooked fish.  Jambalaya was so so relative to other restaurants.  Child's pepperoni pizza was pretty tasty, though.  Guess maybe we should just stick to pizza at a pizza restaurant. With so many other restaurants in this area, the A Game is going to be necessary if they want to stay in business.

The pear and Gorgonzola pizza is amazing. It's like a salad on top of a pizza. It has nuts on it and lettuce. It is sooooo good.  Our waitress was very attentive and we got several drink refills.  My husband got the chipotle chicken pizza. It had black beans and corn on it. It was also pretty awesome.  Great place to get your not-so-conventional pizza!

We were seated very slowly by a non engaged hostess.  She told us our server would be right with us to answer any questions.  That didn't happen.   We watched people get seated and waited on so we got up and left.  The hostess said good bye to us as we left.  Didn't ask what was wrong or anything...just bye.

Something changed! I guess reviews do make changes. I have it another chance and "day and night", much better!! Less wait, great service. It would be a shame because I have to admit their food is great!! Try the Bolognese Spaghetti!  Good job CPK, thanks for listening!!

All of this great laziness going on while we are waiting for refills, service by our server William, and the other servers that just seem to stand around carelessly is indefinitely below par, they truly do not care. Luckily the food backs the service up enough for people to return. We were brought our meals with no plates, and had to ask two different servers for them along with refills. I have been a bartender for a long time, and in order for you to make money you have to at least take decent care of guests. A true lack of customer service and a welcoming attitude. The greeter, Danny, has no personality at all, more of just a 'let me silently walk you to your table as I say nothing and place the menus on the edge of the table beneath the silverware' worker.

The service here was slow and inefficient during the lunch hour. After putting in our order we waited 20 mins before asking what happened to our appetizer.  After more delays, and packing half our food to go because we were out of time we asked for the bill to be split evenly 3 ways. What came back was 3 checks with 3 vastly different amounts.  No time to correct so we paid and left.   As an aside to CPK in general, why would you call a salad "Moroccan Chicken" if there is no chicken in it??

The food is OK but I agree with the other reviews that the service is a mess - waiters wandering around with plates of food trying to find where they belong, appetizers coming out after the main course, etc. The waiters were working hard, it seemed, rushing to meet customer expectations but whatever system was behind them failed miserably.  There must be CPKs that run well.  Someone needs to look at what is wrong here and fix it. I know I won't be back.  There are others, I'm sure.

I am so disappointed with CPK and always , always ,always , always, they don't have a good service!!! It is not an excuse why you can't serve our pizza and drinks on time its because its 4th of July!! And they have lots of customers, of course it is expected that the restaurant will be filled with customers because its a HOLIDAY!!! Why you can't anticipate that??!!!  Yes we may understand that food and drinks and tables will not be ready right away but oh my !!! We waited for an hour just to get our table then another hour to get our sangria and then another hour for the pizza???!!!! Something is wrong with this restaurant the management is very poor!!!! Sangria berry with no berries!l??!!!They used to put berries in it but they forgot!!!  I end up cancelling our pizza since I have noticed its about closing time and a lot of customers are also complaining . I guess that will be the last time we will be going to CPK and i will tell my friends and family how bad CPK is. They made u sign up for their membership just for you to get /earned points whenever you dine ,never mind three times in a row i went there and they told me we can't  find your name in our system, never mind ,what can i say , system is bad and service is poor The server told us that we can raise our complains to Mr. Scott but i guess its a waste of time. They should know how to run a business especially during holiday season.

Steve was awesome. Great food, view, drinks and service. So many places to eat nearby but glad I chose this place. We will be regulars. Manager came out to ensure we were being royalty treated. We were.

This is my first time at this location and I must say it is very nice by the water. My waiter was Isaiah and he was so friendly and personable. I've never had a bad experience at any CPK and this location is my favorite so far.

Have tried this location twice and both times have been very disappointing  The service and management are not good.   Last night went in early for a to go order.   Called ahead for 4 pizzas.  When I arrived, there was no customers in the restaurant, but there were numerous people working in kitchen and wait staff hanging around.   They said it would be a minute to get my pies.   Of the course of the next 15-20 minutes I discovered that only one of my pizzas was actually made and ready.   They had made a mistake on 2 of the others and hadn't even started the 4th.  No apologies, no anything.    So rather than wait further and eat cold pizza (since they weren't going to remake the one that had been ready for over 30 minutes), I left.  Had similar experience with dine in earlier this year.    Slow service and mistakes were made with our orders.  We used to like cpk because the kids can get what they want and flavor is usually good.   But woodlands location has changed that.   Awful.

Good pizza, horrible service. Our waitress was rude and impatient because she was in a hurry to clock out. She gave us very little time to decide on what we wanted, and tried taking away our dishes before we were finished with them. To top it all off, she brought us the checks early. when we told her we needed more time to finish our food. A outing that should have lasted at least an hour was cut to (and I kept track on my watch) a whopping 30 minutes. I won't be eating here for quite some time.

The food and beer is the same excellent quality as every CPK we've been to. Having the consistency is nice.  The updated CPK interior design is refreshing. Modern, laid back, and upscale.  The waitress was quick and attentive. The manager was visiting all the tables. We requested more bread and he promptly brought us more. The food came out quickly after our order was placed. Cudo's to the kitchen staff for being efficient during the dinner rush. There were even 2 large parties at CPK at the time, who ordered around the same time we did. The only wait we encountered was a 10 minute wait when we first walked in. The only hostess must of been busy or indisposed because she wasn't there at the front. So for 10 minutes we stood there in an empty lobby waiting to be acknowledged. Once she arrived she promptly seated us.
My favorite CPK around! Marcus the bartender is great to talk to! Very cool guy. My food was ready really quickly and tasted delicious!
Ordered grilled Rib-eye... Very tasty, perfectly grilled. Good food, and the service is really great (thanks Jonathan). Everything was perfect, I am impressed and definitely recommend this place!

We've been eating at CPK since 1999, in both California and Texas and used to love their pizzas.  Today, we probably had the worst pizzas we've ever had at any CPK location and, Unfortunately,  I don't think we'll be back.  We always went to CPK for pizza, never cared  for anything else. The change in the menu has taken CPK in a very different direction, and it is obvious their focus is not   pizza anymore. The chain is trying to be everything to everybody but, if I want to pay  $24 for a piece of salmon,  CPK is not the place I'll go to.  The restaurant itself is very nice, the location as well, service was ok but nothing spectacular.

Worst service ever!  I was seated and told by a waitress that she had too many tables so I had to wait on a different server. It took about 10 mins of sitting there before my server finally came. After taking my order, it took another 10-15 mins before our server came back with our drinks or bread or anything.  We had to go to the bar and ask where our waiter was since we never received our drinks and the excuse they gave us was Bc it was a long walk from the front of the restaurant to the back patio!   Mind you there's no more than a total of 15 tables occupied in this entire restaurant.  I have been to plenty of CPK but this location had the worst service. Every other server ignored you if it was not their table and our sever was no where to be seen. I definitely will not be coming back here to this location.
Service was prompt, order was accurate but OMG dat pizza!!!!  The Sicilian pizza is amazing.

Last night the manager of this place called the cops on my parents for complaining about service. He fabricated the story saying he repeatedly asked my parents to leave, and that they came around the counter to threaten his staff. Both untrue and other patrons corroborated this to the police. Nothing came of it and my parents left. So by all means go, but don't you dare complain about the awful service.

Nice and reasonable price for lunch set. I had pizza+salad lunch set, it was nice. The server pretty new and gave me wrong salad and my friend got wrong pizza. Anyway, the second time i was there my server is fine and i had bbq chicken salad with avocado.

Gave this location a chance tonight and it was perfect. The location is quite nice being right on Lake Woodlands. The Pasta Jambalaya was tasty with blackened chicken, sausage, shrimp, and crawfish with just the right amount of spice.  The staff was friendly and helpful. Clyde and I will be back. Also, the complaints(reviews) of Will C. (aka PFC Gomer Pile) and his sidekick Bethany W. (W= whitetrash) should be disregarded. They both are (1) time reviewers that displayed their prison rules and ways of exaggerating their experiences, in an attempt to sabotage our local CPK. I understand that people have legit gripes at times, but after reading these two reviews with their mile long list of moans and groans; I can't help but to expose their exaggerated-dirty-falsified accusations as ridiculous fraud. She had the smarts to admit that after reading bad reviews, she not only went to CPK, but booked a large party, and without doing so with the manager. That's a no-brain'r, but if you have Mac & Cheese for brains; that's what you get. Now I remember where I saw them both. They work at Apple Bee's.
Nice pizza. Good customer service. Beautiful view outside the restaurant. We tried first time and we all enjoyed.

We brought the whole family on opening night. CPK was one of our favorite restaurants when we lived in Baton Rouge, so we were excited to see one open in The Woodlands. The food is great, the service is incredible, and the location on the water is fantastic.

I had read a lot of negative reviews on here, but decided to try it out regardless. Had a party of 16, it took 30 minutes for us to be seated (even though we had called ahead and reserved a table) and when finally seated we had to sit at 4 different tables as they couldn't put the tables together according to the manager. The food took about an hour for it to come out, extremely slow service for drinks, bread etc. The food was average, but EXTREMELY over priced for what we received. The worst part about this place is the manager. Extremely rude. He threatened to fine our party $500 as someone had pulled up a chair to the table (so more people could sit together). When one party member received the wrong food, our waitress said "do not talk to the manager, he won't help you. Just don't order it next time" Evidently, he spoke to the manager who was a male.. Not sure his name. He was EXTREMELY rude and said the same thing. NEVER COME TO THIS PLACE! Seriously not worth it!!!

CPK is a fun place to eat, a little pricy but excellent food. Unfortunately, my friend reserved a section for her birthday party, and they gave it away to someone else. I felt that the staff was a little huffy with us, but the manager did give us free appetizers. Overall, it's not my favorite, but it's a safe option.

I have always had good experiences at CPK.  The food is usually delicious and the service while not the most top notch is not usually bad.  My complaint here has nothing to do with my server but with the overall experience itself.  You would think that being in a nice part of the Woodlands that is relatively new that a chain as prominent as CPK would go out of their way to make sure that any new store would adhere to the standards set by the rest of the franchise.  When we arrived we saw that the place was empty so I thought getting a table would be simple.  We were told that there would be a five to fifteen minute wait.  I thought that really odd but didn't mind wating a little while so I said sure.  While waiting three other couples came in, tried to be seated, were told the same thing, looked at the empty dining room and left.  Strike one.  Then when we were finally seated the hostess took us to a table that was still unclean from the previous patrons.  I politely asked if we could please be moved to a table that was clean and she obliged commenting that she hadn't noticed the table being dirty.  Strike two.  Then we ordered an appetizer and when we were almost through my wife noticed a hair in the food that I was about to eat.  Strike three.  The manager happily removed the item from our bill but by this time I was seriously beginning to regret coming to eat here.  Then came the deal breaker that made sure I would never come back.  I got up to use the restroom and as I was walking into the restroom I saw a server named Zach (tall, lanky guy) buttoning up his pants and start to put on his apron.  I was leaving the bathroom just as he finished messing with his apron and was leaving as well and he didn't stop to wash his hands.  That is absolutely disgusting.  Strike four, five, and six.  If that had been my server I would have left right then and there because based on other reviews I've read if you make a complaint the management is so piss poor at dealing with customer complaints or to put it kindly doing their job that they have a habit of calling the police to settle disputes for them.  Our server on the other hand did her job as best as she could considering the environment she works in and earned herself a decent tip.  Do not eat here if you expect a dining experience based on other locations you have been to.  This is the most poorly run California Pizza Kitchens I have ever eaten in.

Will is super!!! Yes a great store manager...definitely going back for the shrimp fettuccini salad. Lindsey was super cool with out group...all 9 of us and we got the fire table with water front view...love love love Huges Landing location

This is such a disappointment.  My wife and daughter have gluten sensitivity so I was very happy they have gluten free pizza.   It may have been gluten free, but it was burnt too.  For the cost this in not excusable, they should be ashamed of themselves. Skip this place, it's not worth the money.
Great decoration,  great service ,  very friendly  staff,  yumi spaghetti,  but the pizza was missing something

After moving to The Woodlands from CA, its such a treat to have CPK in the neighborhood. It's clean, fresh, warm, modern vibe is so welcoming and reminds me of home. The patio has an incredible view of the lake, and they even let us bring our small dog on the patio while we are dining. The food is consistent, fresh, colorful, and so tasty. Getting takeout is super easy and quick with call ahead ordering and someone is always at the take-out counter. I am a CPK lover and will be a customer as long as they are around!
Excellent service, beautiful location, and delicious food! They have updated their menu to include much more than just pizza! We will be back!

This place has decent food, but is HORRIBLY overpriced and the wait staff is mediocre.  I asked the waiter about a special salad advertisted on the table and he pointed me to the regular menu.  When I showed him it was not on the menu and asked him to tell me what was in it, he just looked at the picture and mumbled all the ingredients I could readily see. I asked about a few other ingredients which he assured me it had.  However, it had NONE of the additional ingredients he mentioned.  All that came on it was mixed greens, berries, and feta cheese.  I was shocked when my bill came out and the salad was $19.45!!   Of course the price was not written anywhere, so I questioned the waiter.  He had to go ask around but came back and said the salad was $15 and to add grilled chicken (a small quantity) was almost $5.  I also ordered a non-aloholic drink that was $3 and was never refilled.  So my grand total for a salad and a drink was $24.45!!  I've never spent that much for a salad and drink, even at a nicer restaurant.    The others in my parties ordered pizza which was ok.  Definitely nothing that would justify it being their namesake.    I won't be returning here again.

So glad to see a CPK in our area! Very nice staff and very responsive. Food was delivered really quickly and was hot and delicious. My fave is the Kung Pao Spaghetti! Not too heavy, but spicy. On our visit today, I'd forgotten to order my usual shrimp for my meal. After receiving my meal, I asked for shrimp. The manager let me keep the order I had, but also had a complete order sent out. Although it was totally unnecessary, I was thankful they were attentive and responsive. I typically don't review big chains, but since this is a new location I figured they deserved a shout out!

Half a star. Horrible service on a Wednesday when it was not even busy. They forgot our salad and by the time we received it, we didn't really want it. The meat pizza had almost no sauce and about six pieces of sausage. The veggie pizza had uncooked green peppers and dried mushrooms. Yuck!! Nobody liked it, even the kids. Server was slow and almost non existent. Not acceptable by any standards. We will not be back.

Another excellent meal we had steak pizza and pasta between the 3 of us which was all excellent. The staff were excellent and seem very well trained and engaged in the whole experience. Well done. Again.

Slowest service ever. We had a company outing and wanted to go to Local Pour, but they had an hour and a half wait. That said, we decided to go to CPK. Unfortunately, instead of waiting an hour and a half to get seated, we waited an hour and a half to get the most overpriced, weak-ass gin and tonic I've ever had. We had multiple people leave the party before they even had their drink. Needless to say, I'll never return to this establishment.

The food here is good and very friendly staff, a little over priced but not too bad. My only complaint is they take way too long, twice I had to leave without eating because they ran over an hour to bring my food, don't go if your in a hurry. I hope this improves. I will most likely be going there in the future.

Good and Bad.  The wait staff was ok the few days they were open. Nice variety on the menu.  Big fanfare on ordering a gluten free pizza. With the manager bringing it out and saying what they had done to prepare it. Having said all that, it was cold. The replacement was within 2-3 minutes. They need to come up with a better serving plate the keep it warm longer.   Crust is still much better for gluten free pizza
Went over to try and get lunch. Abandoned at the bar with a menu and silverware. No acknowledgement after 10 minutes of watching drinks go out to other diners. Very disappointing.

Do not go there..we've been asked to wait 10 mins and ended up waiting 40 mins for a table...the shocking part was the place was 1/3 empty...with all the pizza options in the Woodlands...our family will never return. The service is unprofessional.

Very disappointing. I came here with my mother to get take out gluten free pizza, as we both have celiac issues. The service was very good, but once we arrived home and opened the boxes we discovered that both gluten free pizzas were horribly burnt, black around the edges and very dry. We had also picked up a regular pizza for my father, his was perfect and he said it tasted great.  I'll give them two stars for the service and the pizza that was enjoyed, but the gluten free pizzas were very disappointing. I do not expect a gluten free pizza to be identical in taste and texture to a regular pizza, but I do expect it to be edible, not burnt and not dried out.

I've eaten at California Pizza Kitchen many times in Walnut Creek, CA. I was so looking forward to having one of their great Caesar salads again. Sadly, it was not the same. Missing were the large shaved pieces of fresh Parmesan and the anchovy. Even the romaine tasted a bit bitter. Very disappointed. Our friends had The Works pizza which they said was good.

Let me just begun by saying how beautiful this location is...I was so excited for a CPK to be in the Woodlands, for I frequently would visit the location in River Oaks, but the Woodlands location blows the former out of the water! Absolutely beautiful restaurant. I love the colors, wood paneling, every little detail. I especially love the photographs highlighting a bit of Texas AND California. The wait staff was highly attentive and asked if this was my first time dining at CPK. I explained I had been to the RO location many times. The GM (I believe) came out later with a comp'd appetizer welcoming my party to this location and to the dining experience at the Woodlands CPK. My service was great, my pasta was fantastic, the store was packed but my service was fast and friendly. I have gone back one time since this occurrence and I once again received excellent service. This is a restaurant I will happily dine at time and time again!

I went to this location on January 22nd and ordered a chinese chicken salad to go. The cost was about $15. I was stunned with what I received. Basically, a bowl of bagged lettuce with a few thinly sliced pieces of chicken. I truly could have bought this at grocery store for less than $3. I was furious so I sent a complaint on the California Pizza Kitchen's corporate website. Never heard back from them. What a joke.

Typically, I am not a chain kinda gal, ya know? I hold fast to that, every time someone suggest California Pizza kitchen, I am reluctant to go. Every time! And every time I am proven wrong and pleasantly surprised by the spot.   The menu is great! They truly have something for everyone! I love the numerous sections for healthy eaters or vegetarians.    What I love about this spot is obviously, the menu and here are a few other things.. they have a valet right out front. They have tons of seating so you will never wait for a table. Service is always great. They have outdoor seating for nice days. They also have a little outdoor area if your kiddos need to walk a bit.    What I don't love is the cocktails, they are always so sweet. I also do not love the size of the pizzas, a large is quite small. Other than that, this is a great family spot.    We homeschool, I always have my kiddos with me. When out running errands I know this will be a convenient crowd pleasing spot, even if I am reluctant to drop my no chains attitude. When the moon hits your eye like a big pizza pie... enjoy!

I appreciate the GM reached out to rectify my previous poor experience! We met him on my first review and he was really friendly and welcoming!  Hope they spend more time training their staff... Probably will not be back to this location ---great opportunity to try other eateries on this strip. Plus, menu is very limited for this location unlike other CPK.

Good restaurant, good food, good service. The only thing that keeps this review from four stars is that I think it's a little pricey for what you get. We always get the bbq chicken pizza which is really good and if you've never had it, you need to get it. Chicken, red onions, bbq sauce and mozzarella cheese. We also get the chicken Milanese which is breaded and pan fried chicken topped with arugula, diced tomatoes, Parmesan cheese and they give you a lemon wrapped in cheesecloth to squeeze over the top. I think they give complementary bread to the tables, but we weren't offered any. And we probably didn't need any with all the pizza.

I love California pizza kitchen, being someone who hates gooey cheesy pizza ( I know! Shoot me now) it's hard for me to find a place that caters to my love of crust and toppings but also recognizes my disdain for melted cheese. I ordered the California club pizza which comes with arugula, bacon, chicken, avocado, romaine lettuce and a cilantro cream sauce for the topping. This pizza was perfect! Crisp crust, juicy chicken, not too much cheese but the perfect combination of spice and cool flavors. My girlfriend ordered the pepperoni and sausage pizza which comes with handmade spicy sausage. The flavors of that meat made me think of Sicily. Our server was awesome. She took time to suggest drinks we should try, and just had a great demeanor our entire visit. This place is in a great location ok "Restaurant Row" in Hughes Landing.  Tip: after you leave, head to your right and pick up some macaroons for dessert from Macaroons by Patisse.

California pizza kitchen is by far the best restaurant that I have probably been to that actually genuinely takes care of their customers. There were a couple of huge parties at their restaurants and we had to wait for about two hours for our food and the owner was extremely friendly and kind and she apologized and paid for our food. I have never had this experience before and I can positively say that the waiting was a bit annoying but they were extremely accommodating.  As for the food, it was awesome. I have never had pizza like this ever. It was fresh and start out of the oven. They have a great variety of dishes on their menu and it comes in reasonably priced large portions. Great for brunch or dinner with kids.

Man they must be killing it. I stopped by at 10:30 to order a few pizzas and a group of workers were sitting at a table as I walked in. I said are you opened. They all looked at each other and said no we aren't. To say the very least I will not be back. That's embarrassing.  Where is manAgement?

I feel guilty liking a chain. The lunch deals are great though and you can get in and out quicker than other spots in the area.  The lunch menu can get pretty caloric as a "lunch pizza" alone is 600+ calories without the side salad or sandwich. I recently discovered the "half salad" option from the regular menu which also serves as a nice lunch option- solid portion less than 12 dollars.   There's a nice patio out back overlooking Hughes waterway and on a nice day it's perfect for a drink or outdoor lunch.

CPK was our go-to back home so when they finally opened a restaurant in Hughes Landing we were excited to go and eat our favorite dishes. The Thai pizza is hands down a unique blend of flavors. Its so delicious and I hope they never take this off the menu.  Our pepperoni pizza was burnt so the chef was kind enough to come out and apologize and fix us a new one for free!   Service was friendly and food was yummy. We'll be back.

15 ladies doing lunch!! We had a reservation for 12 but at last minute (like minutes before we arrived) called to see if we could add more, no problem! We arrived and tables set up and ready for us. Wait staff were super efficient, they even did separate checks for us all!! It was my first visit here and was impressed by menu, expected just pizza maybe a few other items. WRONG, menu is quite varied. I had the buffalo cauliflower, my new fave food, just need the recipe (hint, hint!) it was so good! Everyone seemed to enjoy their dish and looking around the tables was impressed by diversity, all looking great! I'll definitely return here.

This was a good place to eat some lunch. My fiancé had a carne asada pizza, and my sister as usual a spinach pizza because she's a vegetarian.  Whenever she got her pizza it had pieces of meat but no big deal. It was a great place to eat at.

Get the butter cake. It's life changing. I come here for a nice date night with the man about once a month. I am never disappointed by the food. I get the south west pizza and the sauce it comes with to die for.

Great restaurant with really good service. We have the avocado egg rolls plus the baked potatoes soup is amazing. The location is nice and clean, the friendly atmosphere brings the whole experience together. This is a great location for lunch or a quick dinner. Oh they are also kid friendly.
When there last week. The people were very sweet always checking on us. The food was great and make sure our food was on point. Loveee it mainly the spot where its locate it.

This would be a five star review except for one thing.  The size of the pizza is ridiculously small.  I thought everything was bigger in Texas!!  It is basically a personal size pizza so if you are used to ordering for a family just double what you would normally get and you will be fine....and broke. We ordered a half size grilled vegetable salad and a mushroom pizza and it was $30.00.   As I said, if I doubled the order it would have been the right amount of food.  As for the actual food - pretty good.  Crust was crispy on outside and chewy on the inside ( which is the way it's supposed to be Texas!!) and the mushrooms were good and tasteful Even though the food is good I don't think I will be going back as I don't like to have to go out to eat after I go out to eat.

Can't comment on food because I couldn't order. Despite the hours posted on the cpk website and the Yelp page, when we called to order this location says they closed at 9 pm. Way to lose business, guys.
I'm seating in the patio of the California Pizza in the Woodlands,with my husband... enjoying a delicious Blueberry Ginger Smash and Artichokes and Spinach Dip.

Im going to start this review off with saying the food on 5/11/17  was 2 star Quality but the service displayed by our server Dre made up for it. From the time we sat down to the time we left he had us laughing. Dre is a very funny young man and even when we complained about our food being burnt he apologized and cracked a joke about how it was his fault because he was too hot. Dre is the only reason me and my sister will even think about coming back.  If you happen to come to CPK ask for Dre.

When we first got there a very unfriedly, long faced hostess told us it would take 15 mins to be sitted. After the 15 mins she called us for a table in a very rude way, almost mad, to the point I wanted to ask if she was ok. We got to our table and had a really nice young lady as our server.  Our dinner was ok. We have visited other locations and had some of the same items. We were informed that pizza was gonna take a little longer than usual, I was ok with that and the server made sure we had bread and drinks. Also the other items my family ordered were already there at our table. Eventually my pizza came, but to my dissapoitment it was cold, so I didn't enjoyed it much. Server offered to warm it up  when I mentioned to her, but it was kinda late and I didn't wanna wait when my family had alread finished eating. I also ordered a grilled vegetables salad that I didn't enjoy much either as it had a lot of dressing. I shared with my husband and he thought the same. The dressing didn't allow us to enjoy the salad. It had too much dressing, it was overwhelming. Over all the visit was ok. Three things to sum it all up: 1.Terrible hostess, no smile, just plain annoyed face and rude.  2.Great server 3.meh food.

Pathetic service. Waitstaff are mostly confused and incompetent. The place is not even half full and haven't seen a waiter in the last 20 minutes.  The food is decent, so 2 stars instead of 1. Given then rent they must pay at this location and the lack of patrons, I doubt this place will last.  Avoid

I was so excited to try CPK's new seasonal menu and walked away totally pleased.  There seasonal menu consists of everything but pizza and I was ok with that.  The California Fields Salad, Fire-grilled Ribeye, Hearth Roasted Halibut and the Chicken Picatta were all delicious, but the best part was their new cocktail program. The new cocktails: Executive Decision, California Roots and the Blueberry Ginger Smash are all worth a try. I highly recommend the "California Roots" as it is made with fresh avocado!

The pear and Gorgonzola pizza is amazing. It's like a salad on top of a pizza. It has nuts on it and lettuce. It is sooooo good.  Our waitress was very attentive and we got several drink refills.  My husband got the chipotle chicken pizza. It had black beans and corn on it. It was also pretty awesome.  Great place to get your not-so-conventional pizza!

We were seated very slowly by a non engaged hostess.  She told us our server would be right with us to answer any questions.  That didn't happen.   We watched people get seated and waited on so we got up and left.  The hostess said good bye to us as we left.  Didn't ask what was wrong or anything...just bye.

Something changed! I guess reviews do make changes. I have it another chance and "day and night", much better!! Less wait, great service. It would be a shame because I have to admit their food is great!! Try the Bolognese Spaghetti!  Good job CPK, thanks for listening!!

All of this great laziness going on while we are waiting for refills, service by our server William, and the other servers that just seem to stand around carelessly is indefinitely below par, they truly do not care. Luckily the food backs the service up enough for people to return. We were brought our meals with no plates, and had to ask two different servers for them along with refills. I have been a bartender for a long time, and in order for you to make money you have to at least take decent care of guests. A true lack of customer service and a welcoming attitude. The greeter, Danny, has no personality at all, more of just a 'let me silently walk you to your table as I say nothing and place the menus on the edge of the table beneath the silverware' worker.

The service here was slow and inefficient during the lunch hour. After putting in our order we waited 20 mins before asking what happened to our appetizer.  After more delays, and packing half our food to go because we were out of time we asked for the bill to be split evenly 3 ways. What came back was 3 checks with 3 vastly different amounts.  No time to correct so we paid and left.   As an aside to CPK in general, why would you call a salad "Moroccan Chicken" if there is no chicken in it??

The food is OK but I agree with the other reviews that the service is a mess - waiters wandering around with plates of food trying to find where they belong, appetizers coming out after the main course, etc. The waiters were working hard, it seemed, rushing to meet customer expectations but whatever system was behind them failed miserably.  There must be CPKs that run well.  Someone needs to look at what is wrong here and fix it. I know I won't be back.  There are others, I'm sure.

I am so disappointed with CPK and always , always ,always , always, they don't have a good service!!! It is not an excuse why you can't serve our pizza and drinks on time its because its 4th of July!! And they have lots of customers, of course it is expected that the restaurant will be filled with customers because its a HOLIDAY!!! Why you can't anticipate that??!!!  Yes we may understand that food and drinks and tables will not be ready right away but oh my !!! We waited for an hour just to get our table then another hour to get our sangria and then another hour for the pizza???!!!! Something is wrong with this restaurant the management is very poor!!!! Sangria berry with no berries!l??!!!They used to put berries in it but they forgot!!!  I end up cancelling our pizza since I have noticed its about closing time and a lot of customers are also complaining . I guess that will be the last time we will be going to CPK and i will tell my friends and family how bad CPK is. They made u sign up for their membership just for you to get /earned points whenever you dine ,never mind three times in a row i went there and they told me we can't  find your name in our system, never mind ,what can i say , system is bad and service is poor The server told us that we can raise our complains to Mr. Scott but i guess its a waste of time. They should know how to run a business especially during holiday season.

Steve was awesome. Great food, view, drinks and service. So many places to eat nearby but glad I chose this place. We will be regulars. Manager came out to ensure we were being royalty treated. We were.

This is my first time at this location and I must say it is very nice by the water. My waiter was Isaiah and he was so friendly and personable. I've never had a bad experience at any CPK and this location is my favorite so far.

Have tried this location twice and both times have been very disappointing  The service and management are not good.   Last night went in early for a to go order.   Called ahead for 4 pizzas.  When I arrived, there was no customers in the restaurant, but there were numerous people working in kitchen and wait staff hanging around.   They said it would be a minute to get my pies.   Of the course of the next 15-20 minutes I discovered that only one of my pizzas was actually made and ready.   They had made a mistake on 2 of the others and hadn't even started the 4th.  No apologies, no anything.    So rather than wait further and eat cold pizza (since they weren't going to remake the one that had been ready for over 30 minutes), I left.  Had similar experience with dine in earlier this year.    Slow service and mistakes were made with our orders.  We used to like cpk because the kids can get what they want and flavor is usually good.   But woodlands location has changed that.   Awful.

Good pizza, horrible service. Our waitress was rude and impatient because she was in a hurry to clock out. She gave us very little time to decide on what we wanted, and tried taking away our dishes before we were finished with them. To top it all off, she brought us the checks early. when we told her we needed more time to finish our food. A outing that should have lasted at least an hour was cut to (and I kept track on my watch) a whopping 30 minutes. I won't be eating here for quite some time.

The food and beer is the same excellent quality as every CPK we've been to. Having the consistency is nice.  The updated CPK interior design is refreshing. Modern, laid back, and upscale.  The waitress was quick and attentive. The manager was visiting all the tables. We requested more bread and he promptly brought us more. The food came out quickly after our order was placed. Cudo's to the kitchen staff for being efficient during the dinner rush. There were even 2 large parties at CPK at the time, who ordered around the same time we did. The only wait we encountered was a 10 minute wait when we first walked in. The only hostess must of been busy or indisposed because she wasn't there at the front. So for 10 minutes we stood there in an empty lobby waiting to be acknowledged. Once she arrived she promptly seated us.
My favorite CPK around! Marcus the bartender is great to talk to! Very cool guy. My food was ready really quickly and tasted delicious!
Ordered grilled Rib-eye... Very tasty, perfectly grilled. Good food, and the service is really great (thanks Jonathan). Everything was perfect, I am impressed and definitely recommend this place!

We've been eating at CPK since 1999, in both California and Texas and used to love their pizzas.  Today, we probably had the worst pizzas we've ever had at any CPK location and, Unfortunately,  I don't think we'll be back.  We always went to CPK for pizza, never cared  for anything else. The change in the menu has taken CPK in a very different direction, and it is obvious their focus is not   pizza anymore. The chain is trying to be everything to everybody but, if I want to pay  $24 for a piece of salmon,  CPK is not the place I'll go to.  The restaurant itself is very nice, the location as well, service was ok but nothing spectacular.

Worst service ever!  I was seated and told by a waitress that she had too many tables so I had to wait on a different server. It took about 10 mins of sitting there before my server finally came. After taking my order, it took another 10-15 mins before our server came back with our drinks or bread or anything.  We had to go to the bar and ask where our waiter was since we never received our drinks and the excuse they gave us was Bc it was a long walk from the front of the restaurant to the back patio!   Mind you there's no more than a total of 15 tables occupied in this entire restaurant.  I have been to plenty of CPK but this location had the worst service. Every other server ignored you if it was not their table and our sever was no where to be seen. I definitely will not be coming back here to this location.
Service was prompt, order was accurate but OMG dat pizza!!!!  The Sicilian pizza is amazing.

Last night the manager of this place called the cops on my parents for complaining about service. He fabricated the story saying he repeatedly asked my parents to leave, and that they came around the counter to threaten his staff. Both untrue and other patrons corroborated this to the police. Nothing came of it and my parents left. So by all means go, but don't you dare complain about the awful service.

Nice and reasonable price for lunch set. I had pizza+salad lunch set, it was nice. The server pretty new and gave me wrong salad and my friend got wrong pizza. Anyway, the second time i was there my server is fine and i had bbq chicken salad with avocado.

Gave this location a chance tonight and it was perfect. The location is quite nice being right on Lake Woodlands. The Pasta Jambalaya was tasty with blackened chicken, sausage, shrimp, and crawfish with just the right amount of spice.  The staff was friendly and helpful. Clyde and I will be back. Also, the complaints(reviews) of Will C. (aka PFC Gomer Pile) and his sidekick Bethany W. (W= whitetrash) should be disregarded. They both are (1) time reviewers that displayed their prison rules and ways of exaggerating their experiences, in an attempt to sabotage our local CPK. I understand that people have legit gripes at times, but after reading these two reviews with their mile long list of moans and groans; I can't help but to expose their exaggerated-dirty-falsified accusations as ridiculous fraud. She had the smarts to admit that after reading bad reviews, she not only went to CPK, but booked a large party, and without doing so with the manager. That's a no-brain'r, but if you have Mac & Cheese for brains; that's what you get. Now I remember where I saw them both. They work at Apple Bee's.

CPK is a fun place to eat, a little pricy but excellent food. Unfortunately, my friend reserved a section for her birthday party, and they gave it away to someone else. I felt that the staff was a little huffy with us, but the manager did give us free appetizers. Overall, it's not my favorite, but it's a safe option.

I have always had good experiences at CPK.  The food is usually delicious and the service while not the most top notch is not usually bad.  My complaint here has nothing to do with my server but with the overall experience itself.  You would think that being in a nice part of the Woodlands that is relatively new that a chain as prominent as CPK would go out of their way to make sure that any new store would adhere to the standards set by the rest of the franchise.  When we arrived we saw that the place was empty so I thought getting a table would be simple.  We were told that there would be a five to fifteen minute wait.  I thought that really odd but didn't mind wating a little while so I said sure.  While waiting three other couples came in, tried to be seated, were told the same thing, looked at the empty dining room and left.  Strike one.  Then when we were finally seated the hostess took us to a table that was still unclean from the previous patrons.  I politely asked if we could please be moved to a table that was clean and she obliged commenting that she hadn't noticed the table being dirty.  Strike two.  Then we ordered an appetizer and when we were almost through my wife noticed a hair in the food that I was about to eat.  Strike three.  The manager happily removed the item from our bill but by this time I was seriously beginning to regret coming to eat here.  Then came the deal breaker that made sure I would never come back.  I got up to use the restroom and as I was walking into the restroom I saw a server named Zach (tall, lanky guy) buttoning up his pants and start to put on his apron.  I was leaving the bathroom just as he finished messing with his apron and was leaving as well and he didn't stop to wash his hands.  That is absolutely disgusting.  Strike four, five, and six.  If that had been my server I would have left right then and there because based on other reviews I've read if you make a complaint the management is so piss poor at dealing with customer complaints or to put it kindly doing their job that they have a habit of calling the police to settle disputes for them.  Our server on the other hand did her job as best as she could considering the environment she works in and earned herself a decent tip.  Do not eat here if you expect a dining experience based on other locations you have been to.  This is the most poorly run California Pizza Kitchens I have ever eaten in.

Will is super!!! Yes a great store manager...definitely going back for the shrimp fettuccini salad. Lindsey was super cool with out group...all 9 of us and we got the fire table with water front view...love love love Huges Landing location

This is such a disappointment.  My wife and daughter have gluten sensitivity so I was very happy they have gluten free pizza.   It may have been gluten free, but it was burnt too.  For the cost this in not excusable, they should be ashamed of themselves. Skip this place, it's not worth the money.
Great decoration,  great service ,  very friendly  staff,  yumi spaghetti,  but the pizza was missing something

After moving to The Woodlands from CA, its such a treat to have CPK in the neighborhood. It's clean, fresh, warm, modern vibe is so welcoming and reminds me of home. The patio has an incredible view of the lake, and they even let us bring our small dog on the patio while we are dining. The food is consistent, fresh, colorful, and so tasty. Getting takeout is super easy and quick with call ahead ordering and someone is always at the take-out counter. I am a CPK lover and will be a customer as long as they are around!
Excellent service, beautiful location, and delicious food! They have updated their menu to include much more than just pizza! We will be back!

This place has decent food, but is HORRIBLY overpriced and the wait staff is mediocre.  I asked the waiter about a special salad advertisted on the table and he pointed me to the regular menu.  When I showed him it was not on the menu and asked him to tell me what was in it, he just looked at the picture and mumbled all the ingredients I could readily see. I asked about a few other ingredients which he assured me it had.  However, it had NONE of the additional ingredients he mentioned.  All that came on it was mixed greens, berries, and feta cheese.  I was shocked when my bill came out and the salad was $19.45!!   Of course the price was not written anywhere, so I questioned the waiter.  He had to go ask around but came back and said the salad was $15 and to add grilled chicken (a small quantity) was almost $5.  I also ordered a non-aloholic drink that was $3 and was never refilled.  So my grand total for a salad and a drink was $24.45!!  I've never spent that much for a salad and drink, even at a nicer restaurant.    The others in my parties ordered pizza which was ok.  Definitely nothing that would justify it being their namesake.    I won't be returning here again.

So glad to see a CPK in our area! Very nice staff and very responsive. Food was delivered really quickly and was hot and delicious. My fave is the Kung Pao Spaghetti! Not too heavy, but spicy. On our visit today, I'd forgotten to order my usual shrimp for my meal. After receiving my meal, I asked for shrimp. The manager let me keep the order I had, but also had a complete order sent out. Although it was totally unnecessary, I was thankful they were attentive and responsive. I typically don't review big chains, but since this is a new location I figured they deserved a shout out!

Half a star. Horrible service on a Wednesday when it was not even busy. They forgot our salad and by the time we received it, we didn't really want it. The meat pizza had almost no sauce and about six pieces of sausage. The veggie pizza had uncooked green peppers and dried mushrooms. Yuck!! Nobody liked it, even the kids. Server was slow and almost non existent. Not acceptable by any standards. We will not be back.

Another excellent meal we had steak pizza and pasta between the 3 of us which was all excellent. The staff were excellent and seem very well trained and engaged in the whole experience. Well done. Again.

Slowest service ever. We had a company outing and wanted to go to Local Pour, but they had an hour and a half wait. That said, we decided to go to CPK. Unfortunately, instead of waiting an hour and a half to get seated, we waited an hour and a half to get the most overpriced, weak-ass gin and tonic I've ever had. We had multiple people leave the party before they even had their drink. Needless to say, I'll never return to this establishment.

The food here is good and very friendly staff, a little over priced but not too bad. My only complaint is they take way too long, twice I had to leave without eating because they ran over an hour to bring my food, don't go if your in a hurry. I hope this improves. I will most likely be going there in the future.

Good and Bad.  The wait staff was ok the few days they were open. Nice variety on the menu.  Big fanfare on ordering a gluten free pizza. With the manager bringing it out and saying what they had done to prepare it. Having said all that, it was cold. The replacement was within 2-3 minutes. They need to come up with a better serving plate the keep it warm longer.   Crust is still much better for gluten free pizza
Went over to try and get lunch. Abandoned at the bar with a menu and silverware. No acknowledgement after 10 minutes of watching drinks go out to other diners. Very disappointing.

Do not go there..we've been asked to wait 10 mins and ended up waiting 40 mins for a table...the shocking part was the place was 1/3 empty...with all the pizza options in the Woodlands...our family will never return. The service is unprofessional.

Very disappointing. I came here with my mother to get take out gluten free pizza, as we both have celiac issues. The service was very good, but once we arrived home and opened the boxes we discovered that both gluten free pizzas were horribly burnt, black around the edges and very dry. We had also picked up a regular pizza for my father, his was perfect and he said it tasted great.  I'll give them two stars for the service and the pizza that was enjoyed, but the gluten free pizzas were very disappointing. I do not expect a gluten free pizza to be identical in taste and texture to a regular pizza, but I do expect it to be edible, not burnt and not dried out.

I've eaten at California Pizza Kitchen many times in Walnut Creek, CA. I was so looking forward to having one of their great Caesar salads again. Sadly, it was not the same. Missing were the large shaved pieces of fresh Parmesan and the anchovy. Even the romaine tasted a bit bitter. Very disappointed. Our friends had The Works pizza which they said was good.

Let me just begun by saying how beautiful this location is...I was so excited for a CPK to be in the Woodlands, for I frequently would visit the location in River Oaks, but the Woodlands location blows the former out of the water! Absolutely beautiful restaurant. I love the colors, wood paneling, every little detail. I especially love the photographs highlighting a bit of Texas AND California. The wait staff was highly attentive and asked if this was my first time dining at CPK. I explained I had been to the RO location many times. The GM (I believe) came out later with a comp'd appetizer welcoming my party to this location and to the dining experience at the Woodlands CPK. My service was great, my pasta was fantastic, the store was packed but my service was fast and friendly. I have gone back one time since this occurrence and I once again received excellent service. This is a restaurant I will happily dine at time and time again!

I went to this location on January 22nd and ordered a chinese chicken salad to go. The cost was about $15. I was stunned with what I received. Basically, a bowl of bagged lettuce with a few thinly sliced pieces of chicken. I truly could have bought this at grocery store for less than $3. I was furious so I sent a complaint on the California Pizza Kitchen's corporate website. Never heard back from them. What a joke.

Came for a late lunch, so first I have to say, it was not crowded. Our waiter was attentive and refilled our drinks regularly. Our food came out in an appropriate time. It was delicious!  I had the shrimp scampi zucchini. Fresh vegetables, perfectly cooked pasta. The most pleasurable meal I've had out in a long time! My husband enjoyed his meal too! He doesn't say that often. Can't wait to come back again!

We liked CPK when we were in California, and the one in Galleria area was good too. So I can't wait to try this new CPK in the woodlands area.  The restaurant is right at the bank of Lake Woodlands, and the lake view is nice. However the food was kind of disappointing. I ordered the original BBQ pizza, with pineapple. The taste was OK, but the pizza was burnt (the back of the pizza was almost all black). The pineapple was cut in pretty big size, which was a little weird to me.  So 2 stars for the food, and 1 star for the lake view.

Well, we we're pumped they built a CPK in the area, unfortunately, our visit was not up to par.  Our waiter was great, but he was triple sat, which meant no drinks, napkins, etc the entire visit.  The BBQ CHOP salad was good as expected.  The pizza was a bust. We got a thin crust pizza that was chewy... Have had better pizza out of the freezer... Manager walked around restaurant aimlessly, never once checked on our table.  Overall experience was poor, we won't be back.

15 minutes: no acknowledgement, no drinks, finally got up and left and the manager told us to have goodnight after he had literally just welcomed us in. Clearly not paying attention to customers. All of the waitstaff was screwing around by the bar. Will definitely not go back. There is plenty of fabulous pizza around The Woodlands, we don't need this place.

The horrible service at CPK made me to write this review, and it's my first ever review on yelp. I went twice there,  and both the times I was disappointed.  They need new management to manage waiters, otherwise this place will be a back star for CPK chain.
Meh.... What else is there to say. Service is ok, food is meh, typical chain restaurant. Lacking tons and should probably stay in California. When is Texas Pizza Kitchen opening ?

Horrible service.  This place is a joke! We went there for the gluten-free menu.  It took 10 minutes to get drinks.  Then the drinks were wrong.  I asked to speak to the manager and it took forever.  I finally found him walking on the street in front of the restaurant.  He then came to the table and brought us bread sticks!!!  Remember, we are gluten-free!!!  We cannot eat bread sticks!!!  We then started yelling at him about the horrible service.  He asked us to stop being rude and yelling at him.  We then left and went to the restaurant next door called Escalate's.  The service there was excellent!!!
Rude staff. They act like they are doing you a favor, like they are a five star restaurant with a dress code when their food is mediocre at best. Uncomfortable to go here for a pizza.

We went here for diner and I was craving some pizza. They told us it was a 20 min wait which was okay since it was Friday. 30 minutes later we ask how much longer and they say it's almost ready. It took 45 minutes to get a table and we ended up getting seated at a table that was open since the time we got there (I could see plenty of tables open from the moment we walked in). While we were waiting, it seemed that everyone coming in after was getting seated before us. There reasoning was they called ahead. I believe some people did but it seemed like it was highly unlikely everyone did call ahead. The food was okay but my mojito was really good. Overall I wouldn't come again.

I am writing this review from a restaurant next door to California Pizza Kitchen. We came to the restaurant as a family of 5 and were treated so rudely by the "hostesses", before we were even seated, that we left. It is expensive to take a big family out to eat, so being treated with disrespect is not acceptable. The restaurant was practically empty, there were at least 4 tables to accommodate us, and the hostesses would not seat us, instead saying it would be a 10 minute wait. When I asked why, when there were available tables right in front of us that would be fine, I was given a blank stare and just repeatedly told that it would be 10 minutes. When we decided to leave, the "hostesses" mocked us as we left. I highly recommend Escalantes, who seated us immediately despite being twice as crowded as CPK, were very friendly, and the food was great. There are too many restaurants in The Woodlands to choose from to be treated poorly.

Been going to CPK all my life and ordering the same Italian chopped salad. My only bad comment was it was not chopped up small like normally. But the service was amazing, sat out side on a beautiful patio overlooking the water. We even mentioned it was our first time at this location and the manager brought out their delicious quesadilla and introduced himself. Amazing! I work in the food industry and for this type of service you would normally pay much more. Can't wait to go back!

First day at new office in Hughes Landing. A group of nine went for lunch. Took almost two hours start to finish from about 1120 til after 1.  Service was confused but at least the food was good.   The gift cards were not such a deal as I was charged then told it did not work. So paid cash then checked balance and it was deducted.  The manager did fix this but the 15% "bonus" is only good for January/February not much good for me as I'll be out of town.   My fault for not asking to see the details first Would not give a recommendation for lunch here until they settle things down there!

Horrible service, our waitress was terrible, the restaurant wasn't even busy, now our kids food and appetizer was great, but than she never came back to take our order, because every parent knows place your little ones order first because as parents we have a small window to eat, we had to ask someone to find our waitress, finally ordered and our food came o ordered the sunny side up pizza,it was great, my husband unfortunately was not so good and I told him to order it because last time I had it was yummy, it was really burnt and by than he was just over it! Our waitress called the manager over who was very nice, overall it was good but this waitress we had maybe needs to find employment elsewhere and not waitressing.

Great location next to the water, ant terrific food. Our waiter, Isiah, was an earnest young man willing to learn the ropes of his craft, and attentively observed how to open a bottle of wine and place it in a chiller. He was also quick to have management replace a glass of wine the wind spilt. Hope we see him the next time we visit.

They have a very extensive menu, with a combination of thai or asian food and pizza. The california club pizza its very good, its a salad on top of a pizza with a very nice crust bread. We tried a combination of appetizers that were just ok, avocado egg rolls, lettuce wraps, spinach dip. The mahi tacos, could be much better, they had very hard pieces of fried breading, and didn't like the flour tortilla for it. Kids had pastas, they were very simple and not worth the value, plus they did not include the drinks. Service was slow, our waitress tried her best, but the kitchen was really slow. This place could be much better with a good manager.

The wait staff was great and the food was good. The pepperoni pizza with truffle oil was our favorite! The truffle oil brought out so much flavor in the pizza. Definitely recommend paying the extra price to have the truffle oil.

Walked from our embassy suite to this restaurant and enjoyed a nice dinner. Good service and food. We ordered the guacamole and chicken fettuccine Alfredo. Very delicious! Guacamole is small but has amazing flavor! Chicken fettuccine Alfredo was large enough to share for 2. Would def return again.

I normally don't rate chains, but the lady handling the to go orders was so great and good service deserves to be recognized. She greeted me by name when I walked up, made sure the order was correct and looked good, and sent me on my way. No waiting and the food was still hot when I got it home. Seems simple, but getting hot and accurate to go food is a rarity these days. Really wish I had thought to ask her name.
Lunch at CPK.... Had the Gorgonzola & Pear pizza, it has become my favorite. Great service, great food, I'm hooked..

First time at this location.  Was somewhat disappointed as I have had good experiences at other locations.  We sat outside next to the lake, which was nice. Staff was pleasant but food took a very long time to serve and was mediocre at best.   Mahi mahi tacos featured way overcooked fish.  Jambalaya was so so relative to other restaurants.  Child's pepperoni pizza was pretty tasty, though.  Guess maybe we should just stick to pizza at a pizza restaurant. With so many other restaurants in this area, the A Game is going to be necessary if they want to stay in business.
Nice pizza. Good customer service. Beautiful view outside the restaurant. We tried first time and we all enjoyed.

We brought the whole family on opening night. CPK was one of our favorite restaurants when we lived in Baton Rouge, so we were excited to see one open in The Woodlands. The food is great, the service is incredible, and the location on the water is fantastic.

I had read a lot of negative reviews on here, but decided to try it out regardless. Had a party of 16, it took 30 minutes for us to be seated (even though we had called ahead and reserved a table) and when finally seated we had to sit at 4 different tables as they couldn't put the tables together according to the manager. The food took about an hour for it to come out, extremely slow service for drinks, bread etc. The food was average, but EXTREMELY over priced for what we received. The worst part about this place is the manager. Extremely rude. He threatened to fine our party $500 as someone had pulled up a chair to the table (so more people could sit together). When one party member received the wrong food, our waitress said "do not talk to the manager, he won't help you. Just don't order it next time" Evidently, he spoke to the manager who was a male.. Not sure his name. He was EXTREMELY rude and said the same thing. NEVER COME TO THIS PLACE! Seriously not worth it!!!
